snippet: The sector is spending more than $65 billion a year in new “value-based” payment models, according to a Blue Cross Blue Shield Association study, which looked at 350 programs.
abstract: Survey of Blue Cross insurers, among the most dominant plans in the United States, reveals that health insurers are experimenting with new formulas for reimbursing doctors and hospitals; estimates that $1 out of very $5 in reimbursements is being paid under arrangement in which providers are rewarded for improving care and lowering costs.
lead_paragraph: The sector is spending more than $65 billion a year in new “value-based” payment models, according to a Blue Cross Blue Shield Association study, which looked at 350 programs.
